summary.para: This class is intended for internal use only.
Specifies how I-Load will cut uploaded images.
Disables the cutting process within I-Load image upload wizard and force uploading of images compliant to all contraints.

When disabled is selected in ILoadConfiguration.CutMode, the cutting process is disabled. So, if the upload image is not compliant to all constraints (image size and format), this definition cannot be selected.
If no is compatible with the upload image, the process can't continue, and the user must upload a new image.
Enables the cutting process within I-Load image upload wizard.
This is the default cut mode.
When manual cut mode is selected, the user can cut by himself a portion of image to publish on the web.

If, during the cutting process, the user selects all the image, the resize factor is 100%, and the source image format is compliant to the output image format, then the source image is used as selected image (file copy), otherwise a new image is generated and saved.
Disables the cutting process within I-Load image upload wizard.
Using this option, the cutting process is disabled, but user can still upload every image even if not compatible with all the contraints.
I-Load wizard process will automatically cut source images not compliant to constraints.
During automatic cut, the source image crop is aligned to center.
Represents the definition of an image to upload with control.

remarks.para: control use to store information about size and format of images to upload.
Multiple can be declared and added to a object.
If more than one is declared, then user can select during image upload wizard process which definition to use.

summary.remarks: This property must contain the name of the javascript function to call when the control value changes. The function will receive two parameters: - The control ID (ClientID) - The new control value. The control value can be: - Null: if no image has been selected - A WebImage object: if an image has been selected.

summary.para: Gets or sets the "OnClientControlInitialized" javascript event handler.
summary.remarks: This property must contain the name of the javascript function to call after the control has been initialized (every time the page is loaded) The function will receive two parameters: - The control ID (ClientID) - The control value. The control value can be: - Null: if no image has been selected - A WebImage object: if an image has been selected.

summary.para: Gets or sets how the I-Load control renders windows.
summary.remarks: If the I-Load custom window mode is active then you MUST set the properties and, .

summary.para: Gets or sets the javascript function that I-Load has to invoke to open a new popup window when the custom window mode is active.
summary.remarks: If you set the property, then you MUST also set . The I-Load custom window mode is active only when the property is set to or . This property must contain the name of the javascript function to call when I-Load must open a new popup window (eg: upload wizard window or preview window). The function will receive 10 parameters: - 1) The control ID. - 2) The window label (eg: "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEUPLOAD", "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEEDIT", or "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEPREVIEW"). - 3) The windowId (Everytime a new window is opened, a new windowId is generated). - 4) The URL to display. - 5) The window width. - 6) The window height. - 7) The "Modal" window switch. - 8) The "Center" window switch. - 9) The "Resizable" window switch. - 10) The window title.

summary.para: Gets or sets the javascript function that I-Load has to invoke to close a popup window when the custom window mode is active.
summary.remarks: If you set the property, then you MUST also set . The I-Load custom window mode is active only when the property is set to or . This property must contain the name of the javascript function to call when I-Load must close a popup window (eg: upload wizard window or preview window). The function will receive 5 parameters: - 1) The control ID. - 2) The window label (eg: "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEUPLOAD", "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEEDIT" or "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEPREVIEW"). - 3) The windowId (Everytime a new window is opened, a new windowId is generated). - 4) The popup window object. - 5) A boolean value indicating whether the cancel button has been pressed (true=cancel button pressed / false=cancel button not pressed).

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether, when the I-Load custom window mode is active, the component has to invoke the javascript function "window.top.CustomWindowProvider_GetOpener" in order to get a reference to the opener window.
summary.remarks: The I-Load custom window mode is active only when the property is set to or . If is set to true, then I-Load will invoke the javascript function "window.top.CustomWindowProvider_GetOpener" in order to get a reference to the opener window. If is set to false (default value), then I-Load will automatically detect the opener window. The function "window.top.CustomWindowProvider_GetOpener" will receive 4 parameters: - 1) The control ID. - 2) The window label (eg: "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEUPLOAD", "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEEDIT" or "RAWCIL_WL_IMAGEPREVIEW"). - 3) The windowId (Everytime a new window is opened, a new windowId is generated). - 4) The popup window object.

summary.para: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class rendered by the Web server control on the client when a popup is displayed in Lightbox mode.
summary.remarks: The Lightbox_CssClass is available only when the property is set to .
